00053 int affx::File5_TsvColumn::init()
00054 {
00055   affx::File5_Vector::init();
00056   //
00057   m_kind=FILE5_KIND_TSV_COLUMN;
00058   m_kind_char='C';
00059   //
00060   m_col_name="";
00061   m_clvl=-1;
00062   m_cidx=-1;
00063   //
00064   m_val_i=0;
00065   m_val_f=0;
00066   m_val_d=0;
00067   m_val_string="";
00068   //
00069   return 0;
00070 }
00071 
00072 char affx::File5_TsvColumn::file5_kind_char() {
00073   return 'C';
00074 }

00079 {
00080   return affx::File5_Vector::flush();
00081 }

00085 #define TSV_FIELD_SET(SUFFIX1,SUFFIX2,TYPE)          \
00086   int affx::File5_TsvColumn::set_##SUFFIX1(TYPE val) \
00087   {                                                  \
00088     m_val_##SUFFIX2=val;                             \
00089     return affx::FILE5_OK;                           \
00090   }
00091 
00092 //
00093 TSV_FIELD_SET(c,i,char);
00094 TSV_FIELD_SET(s,i,short);
00095 TSV_FIELD_SET(i,i,int);
00096 TSV_FIELD_SET(f,f,float);
00097 TSV_FIELD_SET(d,d,double);
00098 TSV_FIELD_SET(string,string,const std::string&);
00099 
00100 #undef TSV_FIELD_SET

00102 //////////
00103 
00104 int affx::File5_TsvColumn::push_back_val()
00105 {
00106   //printf("tsv_col(%d,%d)->write_col_val(%d)\n",m_clvl,m_cidx,idx);
00107 
00108   switch (m_dtype) {
00109   case FILE5_DTYPE_CHAR:
00110     return push_back_c(m_val_i);
00111     break;
00112   case FILE5_DTYPE_SHORT:
00113     return push_back_s(m_val_i);
00114     break;
00115   case FILE5_DTYPE_INT:
00116     return push_back_i(m_val_i);
00117     break;
00118   case FILE5_DTYPE_FLOAT:
00119     return push_back_f(m_val_f);
00120     break;
00121   case FILE5_DTYPE_DOUBLE:
00122     return push_back_d(m_val_d);
00123     break;
00124   case FILE5_DTYPE_STRING:
00125     return push_back_string(m_val_string);
00126     break;
00127   default:
00128     FILE5_ABORT("Unhandled case.");
00129     return affx::FILE5_ERR;
00130     break;
00131   }
00132 }

00136 int
00137 affx::File5_TsvColumn::open(const std::string& tsv_name)
00138 {
00139   int rv;
00140   // open the base vector
00141   rv=affx::File5_Vector::open(tsv_name,affx::FILE5_DTYPE_ANY,affx::FILE5_OPEN);
00142   // should test that this is set.
00143   // set_file5_kind_string("file5-tsv-column");
00144   // init the meta-data
00145   attrib_get("tsv-col-name",&m_col_name);
00146   attrib_get("tsv-clvl",&m_clvl);
00147   attrib_get("tsv-cidx",&m_cidx);
00148   //
00149   return 0;
00150 }
00151 
00152 int
00153 affx::File5_TsvColumn::open(const std::string& tsv_name,
00154                             const std::string& col_name,
00155                             int clvl,
00156                             int cidx,
00157                             affx::File5_dtype_t dtype,
00158                             int flags)
00159 {
00160   int rv;
00161   // open the base vector
00162   rv=affx::File5_Vector::open(tsv_name,dtype,flags);
00163   //
00164   set_file5_kind_string("file5-tsv-column");
00165   // init the meta-data
00166   m_col_name=col_name;
00167   m_clvl=clvl;
00168   m_cidx=cidx;
00169   // save the meta-data for later.
00170   attrib_set("tsv-col-name",m_col_name);
00171   attrib_set("tsv-clvl",clvl);
00172   attrib_set("tsv-cidx",cidx);
00173   //
00174   return 0;
00175 }

00178 {
00179   //
00180   affx::File5_Vector::close();
00181   //
00182   return 0;
00183 }

00191 affx::File5_TsvColumn::dump()
00192 {
00193   printf("#%3d:%3d: %p: type=%2d name='%s'\n",m_clvl,m_cidx,this,m_dtype,m_col_name.c_str());
00194   //
00195   return 0;
00196 }

00210   m_kind_char='T';
00211   //

00214   //
00215   m_lineNum=-1;
00216   //
00217   return 0;

00229 // This works as long as it is opened before data is opened.
00230 void
00231 affx::File5_Tsv::openLineIndexes()
00232 {
00233   int flags=affx::FILE5_CREATE|affx::FILE5_OPEN;
00234   //
00235   if (m_line_clvl==NULL) {
00236     m_line_clvl=this->openVector(TSV_LINE_CLVL,affx::FILE5_DTYPE_INT,flags);
00237     if (!m_line_clvl->is_open()) {
00238       FILE5_ABORT("File5_Tsv: cant open: " TSV_LINE_CLVL);
00239     }
00240   }
00241   //
00242   if (m_line_clvl_idx==NULL) {
00243     m_line_clvl_idx=this->openVector(TSV_LINE_CLVL_IDX,affx::FILE5_DTYPE_INT,flags);
00244     if (!m_line_clvl_idx->is_open()) {
00245       FILE5_ABORT("File5_Tsv: cant open: " TSV_LINE_CLVL_IDX);
00246     }
00247   }
00248 }
00249 
00250 int affx::File5_Tsv::open(const std::string& name,int flags)
00251 {
00252   close();
00253   rewind();
00254 
00255   int rv;
00256 
00257   if ((flags&affx::FILE5_REPLACE)==affx::FILE5_REPLACE) {
00258     flags|=affx::FILE5_CREATE;
00259   }
00260 
00261   //
00262   rv=affx::File5_Group::open(name,flags);
00263   if (rv!=0) {
00264     return rv;
00265   }
00266   set_file5_kind_string("file5-tsv");
00267 
00268   // scan for columns.
00269   int num_obj=get_num_objs();
00270 
00271   for (int idx=0;idx<num_obj;idx++) {
00272     affx::File5_Object* obj=get_object_by_idx(idx);
00273     //
00274 #ifdef FILE5_DEBUG_PRINT
00275     printf("### %2d: %-30s: %-20s\n",idx,obj->m_name.c_str(),obj->file5_kind_string().c_str());
00276 #endif
00277     // skip items which cant be cast.
00278     if (obj==NULL) {
00279       continue;
00280     }
00281     //
00282     if (obj->file5_kind_string()=="file5-tsv-column") {
00283       std::string col_name;
00284       int col_clvl;
00285       int col_cidx;
00286       obj->attrib_get("tsv-col-name",&col_name);
00287       obj->attrib_get("tsv-clvl",&col_clvl);
00288       obj->attrib_get("tsv-cidx",&col_cidx);
00289       // printf("tsv-open: found: %s %d %d\n",col_name.c_str(),col_clvl,col_cidx);
00290       //
00291       File5_TsvColumn* col=new affx::File5_TsvColumn();
00292       col->setParent(this);
00293       col->open(obj->m_name);
00294       registerColumn(col,
00295                      col->m_clvl,
00296                      col->m_cidx,
00297                      col->m_col_name);
00298     }
00299     // release the tmp object.
00300     obj->close();
00301     delete obj;
00302   }
00303 
00304   // @todo: set up the last indexes
00305   // m_clvl_last_idx[clvl]++;
00306 
00307   //
00308   m_state=affx::FILE5_STATE_OPEN;
00309   return 0;
00310 }
00311 
00312 int affx::File5_Tsv::close()
00313 {
00314   flush();
00315 
00316   // close the indexes if they are open
00317   if (m_line_clvl!=NULL) {
00318     m_line_clvl->close();
00319     delete m_line_clvl;
00320     m_line_clvl=NULL;
00321   }
00322   if (m_line_clvl_idx!=NULL) {
00323     m_line_clvl_idx->close();
00324     delete m_line_clvl_idx;
00325     m_line_clvl_idx=NULL;
00326   }
00327 
00328   // walk the columns and free them...
00329   for (int clvl=0;clvl<m_columns.size();clvl++) {
00330     for (int cidx=0;cidx<m_columns[clvl].size();cidx++) {
00331       affx::File5_TsvColumn* col=m_columns[clvl][cidx];
00332       if (col!=NULL) {
00333         col->close();
00334         delete col;
00335         m_columns[clvl][cidx]=NULL;
00336       }
00337     }
00338     m_columns[clvl].resize(0);
00339   }
00340   m_columns.resize(0);
00341   //
00342   affx::File5_Group::close();
00343   //
00344   return 0;
00345 }
00346 
00347 /////
00348 
00349 int affx::File5_Tsv::getLevelCount() {
00350   return m_columns.size();
00351 }
00352 
00353 int affx::File5_Tsv::getLineCount() {
00354   // if we have an index, that tells us the total number of lines.
00355   if (m_line_clvl_idx!=NULL) {
00356     return m_line_clvl_idx->size();
00357   }
00358   // if not, we use the number of items
00359   affx::File5_TsvColumn* colptr=getColumnPtr(0,0);
00360   if (colptr!=NULL) {
00361     return colptr->size();
00362   }
00363   // dont have any data...
00364   return -1;
00365 }
00366 
00367 int affx::File5_Tsv::getColumnCount(int clvl) {
00368   if (m_columns.size() == 0) {
00369     return 0;
00370   }
00371   else if (clvl>=m_columns.size()) {
00372     return -1;
00373   }
00374   return m_columns[clvl].size();
00375 }
00376 
00377 int affx::File5_Tsv::getColumnIdx(int clvl,const std::string& cname) {
00378   if ((clvl<0) || (clvl>=m_columns.size())) {
00379     return -1;
00380   }
00381   std::map<std::string, int>::iterator it=m_column_name_map[clvl].find(cname);
00382   if (it==m_column_name_map[clvl].end()) {
00383     // not found
00384     return -1;
00385   }
00386   return it->second;
00387 }
00388 
00389 /////
00390 
00391 void affx::File5_Tsv::resize(size_t new_size) {
00392   // the problem is what to do about the 2nd level columns.
00393   // really this should translate the size as a line number
00394   // and adjust the columns correctly.
00395   // for the moment we just punt and say we cant have them.
00396 
00397   if (m_columns.size()>1) {
00398     FILE5_ABORT("File5_Tsv::resize: Cant resize a multi-level File5_Tsv.");
00399   }
00400 
00401   if (m_line_clvl!=NULL) {
00402     m_line_clvl->resize(new_size);
00403   }
00404   
00405   //
00406   for (int clvl=0;clvl<m_columns.size();clvl++) {
00407     for (int cidx=0;cidx<m_columns[clvl].size();cidx++) {
00408       affx::File5_TsvColumn* col=m_columns[clvl][cidx];
00409       if (col!=NULL) {
00410         col->resize(new_size);
00411       }
00412     }
00413   }
00414 }
00415 
00416 /////
00417 
00418 affx::File5_TsvColumn* affx::File5_Tsv::getColumnPtr(int clvl,int cidx)
00419 {
00420   if ((clvl<0) || (clvl>=m_columns.size()) ||
00421       (cidx<0) || (cidx>=m_columns[clvl].size())) {
00422     return NULL;
00423   }
00424   return m_columns[clvl][cidx];
00425 }
00426 
00427 affx::File5_TsvColumn* affx::File5_Tsv::getColumnPtr(int clvl,const std::string& cname) {
00428   return getColumnPtr(clvl,getColumnIdx(clvl,cname));
00429 }

00433 affx::File5_dtype_t affx::File5_Tsv::getColumnDtype(int clvl,int cidx) {
00434   affx::File5_TsvColumn* col=getColumnPtr(clvl,cidx);
00435   if (col==NULL) {
00436     return affx::FILE5_DTYPE_UNKNOWN;
00437   }
00438   return col->file5_dtype();
00439 }

00442   return getColumnDtype(clvl,getColumnIdx(clvl,cname));
00443 }

00448   affx::File5_TsvColumn* col=getColumnPtr(clvl,cidx);
00449   if (col==NULL) {
00450     return -1;
00451   }
00452   //
00453   *cname=col->getColumnName();
00454   return 0;

00457 ////
00458 
00459 int
00460 affx::File5_Tsv::defineColumn(const int clvl,
00461                               const int cidx,
00462                               const std::string& cname,
00463                               const File5_dtype_t ctype,
00464                               int str_size)
00465 {
00466   // what should it be stored in the file as?
00467   char name_buf[100];
00468   sprintf(name_buf,"tsv-col-%03d-%03d",clvl,cidx);
00469 
00470 #ifdef FILE5_DEBUG_PRINT
00471   if (cidx==0) {
00472     printf("### \n");
00473   }
00474   printf("### defineColumn: '%s': cname='%s' type=%d size=%d\n",
00475          name_buf,cname.c_str(),ctype,str_size);
00476 #endif
00477 
00478   // create it
00479   File5_TsvColumn* col=new File5_TsvColumn();
00480   col->setParent(this);
00481   col->setOptStringSize(str_size);
00482   col->m_col_name=cname;
00483   col->open(name_buf,cname,clvl,cidx,ctype,affx::FILE5_REPLACE);
00484   registerColumn(col,clvl,cidx,cname);
00485 
00486   //
00487   return 0;
00488 }
00489 
00490 int
00491 affx::File5_Tsv::defineColumn(const int clvl,
00492                               const int cidx,
00493                               const std::string& cname,
00494                               const File5_dtype_t ctype)
00495 {
00496   return defineColumn(clvl,cidx,cname,ctype,-1);
00497 }
00498 
00499 int
00500 affx::File5_Tsv::defineStringColumn(const int clvl,
00501                               const int cidx,
00502                               const std::string& cname,
00503                               int size)
00504 {
00505   return defineColumn(clvl,cidx,cname,affx::FILE5_DTYPE_STRING,size);
00506 }
00507 
00508 int
00509 affx::File5_Tsv::registerColumn(affx::File5_TsvColumn* col,
00510                                 const int clvl,
00511                                 int cidx,
00512                                 const std::string& cname)
00513 {
00514   // resize m_columns needed
00515   if (m_columns.size()<=clvl) {
00516     m_columns.resize(clvl+1);
00517     m_column_name_map.resize(clvl+1);
00518     m_clvl_last_idx.resize(clvl+1);
00519   }
00520   if (m_columns[clvl].size()<=cidx) {
00521     m_columns[clvl].resize(cidx+1,NULL);
00522   }
00523 
00524   //
00525   if (m_columns.size()>1) {
00526     openLineIndexes();
00527   }
00528 
00529   // @todo: method to remove old column.
00530   // discard old column if there.
00531   if (m_columns[clvl][cidx]!=NULL) {
00532 #ifdef FILE5_DEBUG_PRINT
00533     printf("### File5_Tsv::registerColumn(%d,%d,'%s'): replacing!\n",
00534            clvl,cidx,m_columns[clvl][cidx]->m_col_name.c_str());
00535 #endif
00536     m_columns[clvl][cidx]->close();
00537     delete m_columns[clvl][cidx];
00538   }
00539 
00540   // remember the mapping
00541   m_columns[clvl][cidx]=col;
00542   m_column_name_map[clvl][cname]=cidx;
00543 
00544   //
00545   return 0;
00546 }
00547 
00548 int
00549 affx::File5_Tsv::dump()
00550 {
00551   for (int clvl=0;clvl<m_columns.size();clvl++) {
00552     for (int cidx=0;cidx<m_columns[clvl].size();cidx++) {
00553       File5_TsvColumn* colptr=m_columns[clvl][cidx];
00554       printf("#%3d:%3d: ptr=%p\n",clvl,cidx,colptr);
00555       if (colptr!=NULL) {
00556         colptr->dump();
00557       }
00558     }
00559   }
00560 
00561   //
00562   return 0;
00563 }
00564 
00565 //////////
00566 
00567 int
00568 affx::File5_Tsv::writeLevel(int clvl)
00569 {
00570   if (m_line_clvl!=NULL) {
00571     // set the map of line_no -> level.
00572     m_line_clvl->push_back_i(clvl);
00573     // set the map of line_no -> vector_idx
00574     int vec_idx;
00575     vec_idx=m_clvl_last_idx[clvl];
00576     m_line_clvl_idx->push_back_i(vec_idx);
00577   }
00578 
00579   //
00580   for (int cidx=0;cidx<m_columns[clvl].size();cidx++) {
00581     File5_TsvColumn* col=m_columns[clvl][cidx];
00582     if (col!=NULL) {
00583       col->push_back_val();
00584     }
00585     else {
00586       // @todo: dont print a warning.
00587       // printf("writeLevel(%d): cidx %d is NULL.\n",clvl,cidx);
00588     }
00589   }
00590   // last index used for this level
00591   m_clvl_last_idx[clvl]++;
00592   // bump to next line.
00593   m_lineNum++;
00594   //
00595   return 0;
00596 }
00597 
00598 int
00599 affx::File5_Tsv::writeLevel(int clvl, int cidx)
00600 {
00601   if (m_line_clvl!=NULL) {
00602     // set the map of line_no -> level.
00603     m_line_clvl->push_back_i(clvl);
00604     // set the map of line_no -> vector_idx
00605     int vec_idx;
00606     vec_idx=m_clvl_last_idx[clvl];
00607     m_line_clvl_idx->push_back_i(vec_idx);
00608   }
00609 
00610   //
00611   //for (int cidx=0;cidx<m_columns[clvl].size();cidx++) {
00612     File5_TsvColumn* col=m_columns[clvl][cidx];
00613     if (col!=NULL) {
00614       col->push_back_val();
00615     }
00616     else {
00617       // @todo: dont print a warning.
00618       // printf("writeLevel(%d): cidx %d is NULL.\n",clvl,cidx);
00619     }
00620   //}
00621   // last index used for this level
00622   m_clvl_last_idx[clvl]++;
00623   // bump to next line.
00624   m_lineNum++;
00625   //
00626   return 0;
00627 }
00628 
00629 /// @brief     Copy the "format" of the file
00630 /// @param     f_tsv     the tsv to copy from
00631 void
00632 affx::File5_Tsv::copyFormat(affx::File5_Tsv& tsv5)
00633 {
00634   //
00635   for (int clvl=0;clvl<tsv5.getLevelCount();clvl++) {
00636     for (int cidx=0;cidx<tsv5.getColumnCount(clvl);cidx++) {
00637       std::string cname;
00638       tsv5.getColumnName(clvl,cidx,&cname);
00639 
00640       affx::File5_TsvColumn* column = tsv5.getColumnPtr(clvl,cidx);
00641       affx::File5_dtype_t type = column->getDType();
00642       int size = column->getOptStringSize();
00643 
00644       defineColumn(clvl,cidx,cname,type,size);
00645     }
00646   }
00647 }
00648 
00649 /////
00650 
00651 int affx::File5_Tsv::getAsStr(int clvl,int cidx,std::string* str)
00652 {
00653   affx::File5_TsvColumn* col=getColumnPtr(clvl,cidx);
00654   if (col==NULL) {
00655     return -1;
00656   }
00657   col->getAsStr(m_lineNum,str);
00658   int lidx;
00659   if (m_line_clvl_idx==NULL) {
00660     lidx=m_lineNum;
00661   }
00662   else {
00663     m_line_clvl_idx->get(m_lineNum,&lidx);
00664   }
00665   return col->getAsStr(lidx,str);
00666 }
00667 
00668 /////
00669 
00670 #define TSV_GET_BODY() {                              \
00671     affx::File5_TsvColumn* col=getColumnPtr(clvl,cidx);  \
00672     if (col==NULL) {                                  \
00673       return -1;                                      \
00674     }                                                 \
00675     int lidx;                                         \
00676     if (m_line_clvl_idx==NULL) {                      \
00677       lidx=m_lineNum;                                 \
00678     }                                                 \
00679     else {                                            \
00680       m_line_clvl_idx->get(m_lineNum,&lidx);          \
00681     }                                                 \
00682     return col->get(lidx,val);                        \
00683   }
00684 
00685 #define TSV_GET_FUNC(TYPE)                                              \
00686   int affx::File5_Tsv::get(int clvl,int cidx,TYPE* val)                 \
00687   {                                                                     \
00688     TSV_GET_BODY();                                                     \
00689   }                                                                     \
00690   int affx::File5_Tsv::get(int clvl,const std::string& cidx,TYPE* val)  \
00691   {                                                                     \
00692     TSV_GET_BODY();                                                     \
00693   }
00694 
00695 #define TSV_GET_LINE_BODY() {                         \
00696     affx::File5_TsvColumn* col=m_columns[clvl][cidx]; \
00697     return col->get(lineIx,val);                      \
00698     }
00699 
00700 #define TSV_GET_LINE_FUNC(TYPE)                                            \
00701     int affx::File5_Tsv::getLine(int clvl,int cidx, int lineIx, TYPE* val) \
00702     {                                                                      \
00703         TSV_GET_LINE_BODY();                                               \
00704     }                                                                      \
00705 
00706 
00707 TSV_GET_FUNC(std::string);
00708 TSV_GET_FUNC(char);
00709 TSV_GET_FUNC(int);
00710 TSV_GET_FUNC(float);
00711 TSV_GET_FUNC(double);
00712 
00713 TSV_GET_LINE_FUNC(float);
00714 
00715 #undef TSV_GET_FUNC
00716 #undef TSV_GET_BODY
00717 
00718 /////
00719 
00720 #define TSV_SET_BODY(SUFFIX) {                        \
00721     affx::File5_TsvColumn* col=getColumnPtr(clvl,cidx);  \
00722     if (col==NULL) {                                  \
00723       return -1;                                      \
00724     }                                                 \
00725     return col->set_##SUFFIX(val);                    \
00726   }
00727 
00728 #define TSV_SET_FUNC(SUFFIX,TYPE)                                       \
00729   int affx::File5_Tsv::set_##SUFFIX(int clvl,int cidx,TYPE val)         \
00730   {                                                                     \
00731     TSV_SET_BODY(SUFFIX);                                               \
00732   }                                                                     \
00733   int affx::File5_Tsv::set_##SUFFIX(int clvl,const std::string& cidx,TYPE val) \
00734   {                                                                     \
00735     TSV_SET_BODY(SUFFIX);                                               \
00736   }
00737 
00738 TSV_SET_FUNC(c,char);
00739 TSV_SET_FUNC(i,int);
00740 TSV_SET_FUNC(f,float);
00741 TSV_SET_FUNC(d,double);
00742 TSV_SET_FUNC(string,const std::string&);
00743 
00744 #undef TSV_SET_FUNC
00745 #undef TSV_SET_BODY
00746 
00747 /////
00748 
00749 int affx::File5_Tsv::flush()
00750 {
00751   if (m_state!=affx::FILE5_STATE_OPEN) {
00752     return 0;
00753   }
00754 
00755   for (int clvl=0;clvl<m_columns.size();clvl++) {
00756     for (int cidx=0;cidx<m_columns[clvl].size();cidx++) {
00757       affx::File5_TsvColumn* col=m_columns[clvl][cidx];
00758       if (col!=NULL) {
00759         col->flush();
00760       }
00761     }
00762   }
00763 
00764   return 0;
00765 }
00766 
00767 //
00768 int affx::File5_Tsv::rewind()
00769 {
00770   m_lineNum=-1; // point to
00771   return affx::FILE5_OK;
00772 }
00773 
00774 int affx::File5_Tsv::lineNum()
00775 {
00776   return m_lineNum;
00777 }
00778 
00779 int affx::File5_Tsv::lineLevel()
00780 {
00781   int clvl;
00782   // if not set, everything is "0" level
00783   if (m_line_clvl==NULL) {
00784     return 0;
00785   }
00786   m_line_clvl->get(m_lineNum,&clvl);
00787   return clvl;
00788 }
00789 
00790 int affx::File5_Tsv::nextLevel(int clvl)
00791 {
00792   // @todo: this is only for a single level.
00793   return nextLine();
00794 }
00795 
00796 // No binding so just inc
00797 int affx::File5_Tsv::nextLine()
00798 {
00799   // advance the current line.
00800   m_lineNum++;
00801 
00802   // and check if we looking at a line.
00803 
00804   if (m_line_clvl==NULL) {
00805     // dont have a m_line_clvl index, so use the first column
00806     // as a proxy for the size.
00807     // do we have a [0][0] column?
00808     if ((m_columns.size()==0) || (m_columns[0].size()==0)) {
00809       return affx::FILE5_EOF;
00810     }
00811     // not off the end of this column?
00812     if (m_lineNum<m_columns[0][0]->m_vec_fill_idx) {
00813       return affx::FILE5_OK;
00814     }
00815   }
00816   else {
00817     if (m_lineNum<m_line_clvl->m_vec_fill_idx) {
00818       return affx::FILE5_OK;
00819     }
00820   }
00821 
00822   // backup
00823   m_lineNum--;
00824   return affx::FILE5_EOF;
00825 }
00826 
00827 
00828 //////////
00829 
00830 int affx::File5_Tsv::gotoLine(int line)
00831 {
00832   m_lineNum=line;
00833   return affx::FILE5_OK;
00834 }
00835 
00836 int affx::File5_Tsv::findFirst(int clvl,const std::string& cname,const std::string& val)
00837 {
00838   return findFirst(clvl,getColumnIdx(clvl,cname),val);
00839 }
00840 
00841 int affx::File5_Tsv::findFirst(int clvl,int cidx,const std::string& val)
00842 {
00843   std::string tmpval;
00844 
00845   // @todo: BAD! linear scan.
00846   rewind();
00847   while (nextLine()==affx::FILE5_OK) {
00848     getAsStr(0,cidx,&tmpval);
00849     // debugging
00850     // printf("%3d: ",lineNum()); printfRow();
00851     //
00852     if (tmpval==val) {
00853       return affx::FILE5_OK;
00854     }
00855   }
00856   return affx::FILE5_ERR;
00857 }
00858 
00859 void affx::File5_Tsv::printfTabs(int cnt)
00860 {
00861   for (int i=0;i<cnt;i++) {
00862     printf("\t");
00863   }
00864 }
00865 
00866 int affx::File5_Tsv::printfHeader()
00867 {
00868   for (int clvl=0;clvl<m_columns.size();clvl++) {
00869     printfTabs(clvl);
00870     //
00871     for (int cidx=0;cidx<m_columns[clvl].size();cidx++) {
00872       if (cidx!=0) {
00873         printf("\t");
00874       }
00875       File5_TsvColumn* colptr=m_columns[clvl][cidx];
00876       if (colptr==NULL) {
00877         printf("NULL");
00878       }
00879       else {
00880         printf("%s",colptr->m_col_name.c_str());
00881       }
00882     }
00883     printf("\n");
00884   }
00885   return affx::FILE5_OK;
00886 }
00887 
00888 int affx::File5_Tsv::printfRow()
00889 {
00890   int clvl=0;
00891   std::string val;
00892 
00893   for (int cidx=0;cidx<m_columns[clvl].size();cidx++) {
00894     if (cidx!=0) {
00895       printf("\t");
00896     }
00897     getAsStr(0,cidx,&val);
00898     printf("%s",val.c_str());
00899   }
00900   printf("\n");
00901   return affx::FILE5_OK;
00902 }
00903 
00904 
00905 /// @brief     Look inside the file and get the count of rows of a tsv
00906 /// @param     file_name 
00907 /// @param     tsv_name  
00908 /// @return    Number of rows, -1 if there is any error.
00909 
00910 int affx::File5_Tsv::getFileTsvLineCount(const std::string& file_name,
00911                                          const std::string& tsv_name)
00912 {
00913   affx::File5_File* file5;
00914   affx::File5_Tsv* tsv5;
00915   int rowCount=-1;
00916 
00917   //
00918   file5=new affx::File5_File();
00919   if (file5->open(file_name,affx::FILE5_OPEN_RO)==0) {
00920     // "/tsv" is the same as "/tsv" because the tsv is the root group.
00921     if (file5->name_exists(tsv_name)) {
00922       tsv5=file5->openTsv(tsv_name,affx::FILE5_OPEN);
00923       if (tsv5->is_open()) {
00924         rowCount=tsv5->getLineCount();
00925       }
00926       tsv5->close();
00927       delete tsv5;
00928     }
00929   }
00930   file5->close();
00931   delete file5;
00932 
00933   return rowCount;
00934 }
00935 
00936 /// @brief     Look inside the file and get the count of rows of a tsv
00937 /// @param     file_name 
00938 /// @param         group_name   
00939 /// @param     tsv_name  
00940 /// @return    Number of rows, -1 if there is any error.
00941 
00942 int affx::File5_Tsv::getFileTsvLineCount(const std::string& file_name,
00943                                                                                  const std::string& group_name,
00944                                          const std::string& tsv_name)
00945 {
00946   affx::File5_File* file5;
00947   affx::File5_Group* group5;
00948   affx::File5_Tsv* tsv5;
00949   int rowCount=-1;
00950 
00951   //
00952   file5=new affx::File5_File();
00953   if (file5->open(file_name,affx::FILE5_OPEN_RO)==0) {
00954         if (file5->name_exists(group_name))
00955         {
00956           group5 = file5->openGroup(group_name, affx::FILE5_OPEN_RO);
00957           if (group5 != NULL)   {       
00958             if (group5->name_exists(tsv_name)) {
00959               tsv5=group5->openTsv(tsv_name,affx::FILE5_OPEN_RO);
00960               if (tsv5->is_open()) {
00961                 rowCount=tsv5->getLineCount();
00962               }
00963               tsv5->close();
00964               delete tsv5;
00965             }
00966             group5->close();
00967             delete group5;
00968           }
00969         }
00970   }
00971   file5->close();
00972   delete file5;
00973 
00974   return rowCount;
00975 }
